confiscate.translation[0].definitions[0]: to officially take private property away from someone, usually as a punishment
Miss Williams confiscated all our sweets.
Many opposition supporters had their goods confiscated.
confiscate.translation[1].definitions[0]: to officially take private property away from someone, for example because a crime has been committed
The state can confiscate criminalsâ€™ profits from books or movies describing their crimes.
